description.value:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, [[/r 1 #persistent fire]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage}, and 1 fire splash damage.

rules.text: Effect: The bomb also deals [[/r 1 #persistent fire]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage}

description.value:
Activate A Strike

Alchemist's fire is a combination of volatile liquids that ignite when exposed to air. Alchemist's fire deals 1d8 fire damage, [[/r 1 #persistent fire]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage}, and 1 fire splash damage.

rules.text: Effect: The bomb also deals [[/r 1 #persistent fire]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage}

description.value: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.
These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.
A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Thieves' Tools (Replacement Picks)]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.
These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.
Plus [[/r 1 #persistent fire]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage} and [[/r 1[fire] # fire splash damage]]{1 Fire splash damage}

Trigger Wendlyn is targeted with an attack by an attacker she can see

Effect Wendlyn gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
Wendlyn doesn't trigger reactions from movement when she Strides half her Speed or less.

Wendlyn deals an extra [[/r 1d6 #precision]]{1d6 precision damage} to flat-footed creatures

When the monster Strikes a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.
On the first round of combat, if Wendlyn rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted yet are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Flat-Footed]{Flat-Footed} to her.
